emails.snippet: Shalom, Purim is a joyful time of the year and a really fun time at the Village Shul. We hope to see you over Purim and joining us in the Mitzvos of the Day. Charity: There is a tradition before the
emails.body:
Shalom,

Purim is a joyful time of the year and a really fun time at the Village Shul. We hope to see you over Purim and joining us in the Mitzvos of the Day. üéâ

Charity: üí∞
There is a tradition before the Megillah Reading on the first night to give Machtzis Hashekel (3 half dollars or $1.50) to Charity to commemorate our responsibility to the community as was done in the times of the Bait Hamikdash.

There is also a Mitzvah to give Matonos L‚Äôevyonim (a cash gift to the poor) on Purim. The Rabbi‚Äôs can distribute your gift to those in need by an online donation  HERE   today, or with cash at the Megillah Reading.

Megillah: üìú
On Monday, March 2nd at 6:20 PM, please join us for an introduction to Purim, followed by the Wendy Zinner z‚Äùl Legacy of Leadership Award ‚Äì ‚ÄúEshet Chayil.‚Äù

The Megillah Readings will take place at:
‚Ä¢ 6:45 PM ‚Äì First Reading
‚Ä¢ 8:30 PM ‚Äì Second Reading

Following the first Megillah Reading, refreshments will be served for breaking the fast. All are invited to attend.
Come in your costume and claim your treat! üé≠

On Tuesday, March 3rd, Megillah Readings will take place at 7:25 AM and 4:15 PM.
Please see the full schedule below for all reading times.

Mishloach Manot: üéÅ
The Shul initiative of Mishloach Manot is well on the way. Thank you to those who participated.

You can distribute your own as well by packing 2 food items and giving them to a Jewish friend or neighbor.

Purim Party: üçΩÔ∏èThe Purim Carnival will start at 3:00 PM on March 3rd.
To register, Please click  HERE .The Shul Purim in the Caribbean¬†Party will begin at 5:00 PM on Tuesday, March 3rd¬†(sold out event).
Looking forward to spending this fun days together,
Rabbi Tzvi Sytner
Rabbi Shlomo Katz          CLICK HERE TO REGISTER         CLICK HERE TO DONATE             www.ourvillageshul.com      The Village Shul
1072 Eglinton Avenue West
Toronto, ON M6C 2E2
https://www.ourvillageshul.com  
Unsubscribe | Manage Preferences
Delivered to matthew@levinelegal.caCan't see any pictures?

emails.snippet: Trouble viewing this email? Read it online (Le texte fran√ßais se trouve sous le texte anglais) Please join us for the annual International Women's Day program - an engaging, inclusive, and action-
emails.body:
(Le texte fran√ßais se trouve sous le texte anglais)
Please join us for the annual International Women‚Äôs Day program - an engaging, inclusive, and action-focused conversation dedicated to raising awareness, driving meaningful change, and inspiring collective action toward a more equitable justice system and society for all women.
Thursday, March 5, 2026
5:45 - 7:45 p.m. 
Virtual program
This year‚Äôs program will feature a dynamic discussion on advancing gender equality through law, policy, and collective advocacy, while recognizing the persistent barriers and discrimination women continue to face within legal systems and society at large.
Guest speakers will explore critical issues at the intersection of women‚Äôs rights and justice, including:
¬∑Safeguarding the freedom to participate fully and lead in all areas of society
¬∑Addressing systemic shortcomings that fail survivors
¬∑Confronting bias embedded in institutions and processes
¬∑Examining the disproportionate impact of these shortcomings on marginalized women
¬∑Identifying practical ways to advance substantive equality
Drawing on urgent, real-world challenges, this program will also include a timely examination of the unique pressures confronting women in the legal professions, with particular attention to the safety and security of Indigenous and racialized women. We invite all participants to reflect, engage, and take action in advancing a more just and equitable society.
This program has been accredited for 2 hours of EDI Professionalism content.
This program is being organized by the Law Society of Ontario, Ontario Bar Association (OBA) and the OBA Women Lawyers Forum, Women‚Äôs Law Association of Ontario (WLAO), Women‚Äôs Legal Education and Action Fund (LEAF), Barbra Schlifer Commemorative Clinic, Young Women in Law (YWL) and Women in Canadian Criminal Defence (WiCCD).  
RSVP
This public event is free. For additional information and to register to receive the webcast link, please RSVP (https://trk.cp20.com/click/ci9l-30eu9v-4imgv8-kwske330/). 
The Law Society of Ontario makes reasonable accommodations to enable persons with disabilities to attend and participate in its programs, including providing auxiliary aids and services upon request and removing architectural and communication barriers that are structural in nature where readily achievable. To request any auxiliary aids or services or if you have any questions regarding accessibility, please contact equityevents@lso.ca (mailto:equityevents@lso.ca). 
The Law Society of Ontario regularly livestreams LSO events and takes photographs, audio, and video recordings, and creates other forms of content during its events. Please review the Notice of multimedia and disclaimer (https://trk.cp20.com/click/ci9l-30eu9v-4imgv9-kwske331/) for more information.

La conversation mettra √©galement en √©vidence des moyens concrets de renouveler et de renforcer notre engagement commun √† atteindre l‚Äô√©galit√© r√©elle.

Nous invitons tous les participants √† r√©fl√©chir, √† s‚Äôengager et √† agir pour faire progresser une soci√©t√© plus juste et √©quitable.

DANIEL FABIANO

Are you tackling your first privacy law issue? This practical CPD session gives you foundational knowledge to navigate key concepts, legislation, and compliance challenges with confidence. Matthew,

Your energy is your greatest asset.

It influences how you think, feel, and show up every day. But energy isn't just about physical stamina‚Äîit‚Äôs deeply tied to emotions, focus, and self-communication.

Think about a time when you felt unstoppable‚Ä¶

A time when ideas flowed easily, and you had the drive to take on anything. That state isn‚Äôt rare. It can be a daily experience.

üí° The Triad is your key to unlocking peak potential.

By using these three fundamental forces, you can create a powerful internal system that fuels you through any challenge. ‚¨áÔ∏è

üìù The Triad: Your Blueprint for Peak Energy

Tony teaches that energy is both physical and emotional. Your feelings directly shape energy levels, and emotions are influenced by three interconnected forces.

üî• Physiology: How you use your body

üéØ Focus: Where you direct your attention

üó£ Language: How you communicate with yourself

Mastering the forces of the Triad creates a powerful foundation that sustains momentum.

As a result, you‚Äôll build a lasting framework for energy, clarity, and resilience.

‚öì Mastering Your Triad: The Energy Formula

üí™ 1. Physiology: Reset Your Body

Your physical state affects mental and emotional well-being.

Something as simple as a posture shift‚Äîstanding tall, shoulders back, deep breathing‚Äîcan create an energy boost.

Try these proven strategies to elevate your physiology daily. üëá

- Prioritize sleep: Reduce screen time before bed, dim the lights, and allow the body to rest deeply.

- Build strength: Tony‚Äôs trainer, Billy Beck, recommends squats, lunges, push-ups, and planks. Just 10 minutes daily strengthens the body and keeps you vibrant.

- Fuel wisely: Nutrient-dense foods (fruits, veggies, beans, lean proteins) may reduce disease risk. Swap one processed item for a whole food and notice the difference.

Small, consistent shifts in how you move, rest, and nourish your body create a foundation for lasting energy and vitality.

üëÄ 2. Focus: Direct Your Attention

Where focus goes, energy flows.

Your attention determines your energy. Dwelling on problems drains you while focusing on possibilities fuels momentum.

- Morning reset: Start the day with Tony‚Äôs priming exercise (https://go.tonyrobbins.com/e3t/Ctc/OT+113/d4K3xc04/MXdWwmdFGdMW6P1CfR8txcD-W1m0cDV5KZFtbN2nfYxK3prCCW7lCdLW6lZ3lLW7KNC8X1cHSsQW8VPd0P5y1H2cW7vX6ZS8-NZzkW75q68D5P7gJLW8sg42858MpfvW4Dvx4h49ztzhW5fTrvK8H9t1DVHqSJV7cg7-8W8Wcnks6xMtXkW2sfv6y4-FbYPW83pmkw9f-0QHW1S4tXC5h7_7CW96rf713-m7hRW1_61cs7rFw08W1prdbk2z1ltLW5_dWGC75W-zxW2-gzM94WXymnW1KCMsg3cwcMyW1pldXt6RxwhYW2T5K8X1l4CLFW42YFTX25ywZgW6jTyHK1_TsGzW2vSt6P5pXM65W2-v4GW92YWLHf7F_ZRn04 ) ‚Äîa mix of breathing, gratitude, and visualization that sets the tone for success.

- Intentional breaks: Short mental resets throughout the day improve clarity. Even two minutes of deep breathing can restore focus.

- Power questions: Replace "Why am I so tired?" with "How can I boost my energy in this moment?" The quality of your experience is a direct reflection of the questions you ask yourself.

By consciously directing your focus, you can shift your energy, enhance clarity, and create a more empowered state throughout the day.

üí¨ 3. Language: Transform Your Communication

Words create reality, internally and externally.

Saying ‚ÄúI‚Äôm drained‚Äù reinforces fatigue. Saying ‚ÄúI‚Äôm recharging‚Äù encourages renewal.

- Notice patterns: Catch phrases that drain energy ("I can't." "I'm overwhelmed." "This is impossible.") and shift them.

- Interrupt & replace: When negative language appears, move physically and swap it for an empowering alternative.

- Elevate your self-talk: Speak to yourself as you would a close friend. Use encouraging, solution-focused language to reinforce confidence and energy.

The words you choose shape your emotions and energy. By shifting your language to be more empowering, you can create a more resilient and energized state.

üí• Your Challenge This Week: Create Your Triad Practice

üì© Take these three steps to create momentum:

- Physiology: Choose one habit to reinforce‚Äîbetter posture, deep breathing, hydration, or movement.

- Focus: Prioritize mental resets during the day, redirecting attention to something energizing.

- Language: Replace three energy-draining phrases with empowering alternatives.

These small shifts strengthen your energy system, allowing you to move toward your most important goals.

When you align your Triad‚Äîphysiology, focus, and language‚Äîevery aspect of well-being expands, fueling your energy, relationships, and fulfillment.

La tua fiducia √® importante e lavoriamo con impegno per garantire che ogni email che ricevi soddisfi tali requisiti. Se hai bisogno di ulteriori chiarimenti sulle nostre politiche di conformit√† o sugli obblighi legali, non esitare a chiedere. Trasparenza e responsabilit√† sono centrali nella nostra strategia di comunicazione e saremo lieti di fornire ulteriori dettagli se necessario. Informazioni di contatto. Ci impegniamo a garantire che tutti i canali di comunicazione siano aperti e facilmente accessibili. Che si tratti di una domanda, di un commento o di una segnalazione, il nostro team √® pronto ad assisterti. Per assistenza, contatta il nostro team via email rispondendo a questo messaggio oppure scrivendo a support@tonyrobbins.com. Grazie per rimanere in contatto. Puntiamo a una comunicazione chiara e affidabile, facile da consultare anche in seguito. Le email sono uno dei tanti modi in cui restiamo in contatto, ma comprendiamo che non siano perfette per tutti. Se preferisci un altro modo per comunicare o restare aggiornato, faccelo sapere. Che sia tramite i social media, una chiamata diretta o un altro canale, siamo aperti a trovare il modo pi√π efficace per condividere informazioni con te. Ogni email inviata ha l‚Äôobiettivo di offrire valore e apprezziamo sinceramente il tuo tempo e la tua attenzione. Questo footer √® stato progettato per garantire trasparenza, fornire informazioni essenziali e offrirti il pieno controllo sulle tue preferenze di comunicazione. Ci auguriamo che soddisfi le tue aspettative, ma se desideri vedere dei miglioramenti, siamo sempre pronti ad ascoltarti. Cordiali saluti, Il Team di Supporto di Robbins Research International, Inc </div>

emails.snippet: Hi Ayman, Thank you for your time yesterday and great to catch up. I just tried to book our follow up session for next week, but the latest I can find is 1pm. Matthew, our MLRO is based in Canada so
emails.body:

emails.snippet: Dear Matthew Levine, 73727S You are receiving this reminder because the Law Society's records indicate that you have not yet filed your Annual Report for the past calendar year. Annual reports must
emails.body:
Dear Matthew Levine, 73727S
 
You are receiving this reminder because the Law Society's records indicate that you have not yet filed your Annual Report for the past calendar year.
 
Annual reports must be filed through your LSO Connects account by March 31. It is important to file by March 31, as the administrative suspension process will start after that date.
 
You will not receive any further reminders once you have successfully submitted your Annual Report.
 
If you believe you have already filed your Annual Report, please go to your LSO Connects account before March 31 and select the Annual Report tile to ensure that your Annual Report has been submitted. Once you have successfully submitted your Annual Report, the ‚ÄúStatus Reason‚Äù will change to ‚ÄúSubmitted‚Äù. 
 
 
Matthew Levine, 73727S

** Join us at RC Show 2026
------------------------------------------------------------

Hello,

KioCaf√© is excited to exhibit at

RC Show 2026,
Canada‚Äôs leading hospitality and foodservice trade event.

The International Centre

Mississauga, ON
March 8 ‚Äì March 10, 2026

Booth #5208


** ‚Üì
------------------------------------------------------------


** Solutions for Unattended & Self-Service Environments
------------------------------------------------------------

KioCaf√© offers fully robotic and self-service solutions designed for efficient, unattended operation.
Compact, user-friendly systems enable quick ordering, automated payments, and consistent drink preparation.


** Our Software Inclusions
------------------------------------------------------------

KioCaf√© provides a management app, a reporting dashboard, and a customer-facing app designed to support convenient mobile ordering, streamline day-to-day operations, and improve overall efficiency.


** Our Caf√© Experience
------------------------------------------------------------

KioCaf√© delivers a distinctive caf√© experience through thoughtfully designed self-service solutions.
Built on core standards and technology, we enable efficient operations and consistent quality.

emails.snippet: Hi Matthew, Hope you are well. Off this for right now but will get back on it eventually. Max Hill, CET Mascore Helical Piles 905-807-4389 From: Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca> Sent:
emails.body:
Hi Matthew,



Hope you are well.



Off this for right now but will get back on it eventually.



Max Hill, C.E.T

Mascore Helical Piles

905-807-4389



*From:* Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
*Sent:* Tuesday, February 24, 2026 1:15 PM
*To:* Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca>
*Subject:* Re: New Project



Hi Max



I see that I was going to send a note. My understanding is that there is an
informal qualification / screening procedure, which is the first step.
Based on experience, Mascore would qualify. Mascore would then have access
to funds for quite a lot of the early stage work.



Please do let me know what you think about the time line. (I'm keen to dig
into this; but, of course, "its your shot".)



cheers





*Matthew AJ* *Levine*

Barrister & Solicitor



This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and
is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message
in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.







On Tue, Feb 10, 2026 at 3:30‚ÄØPM Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
wrote:

Hi Max



https://nrc.canada.ca/en/support-technology-innovation/nrc-irap-support-intellectual-property.
i will send a short note. My understanding is that this is the best
starting point, and then there may be provincial funding.



what about overall. when do you want to talk to the patent people?





*Matthew AJ* *Levine*

Barrister & Solicitor



This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and
is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message
in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.







On Mon, Feb 9, 2026 at 12:23‚ÄØPM Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca> wrote:

Hi Matthew,



Have looked into the government funding and seems that anything that‚Äôs
available is for large companies and the loan amounts are aggressive.



Do you have any ideas?



Max Hill, C.E.T

Mascore Helical Piles

905-807-4389



*From:* Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
*Sent:* Monday, February 9, 2026 12:15 PM
*To:* Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca>
*Subject:* Re: New Project





Hey Max



When you have time, please let me know where things are at on your side and
any additional info I can informally review.



I would be confident in working on the government funding.





*Matthew AJ* *Levine*

Barrister & Solicitor



This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and

On Mon, Jan 12, 2026 at 12:11‚ÄØPM Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca> wrote:

I haven‚Äôt looked into the grant money that would be available for this but
will.



I would need some time to think about this.



Have been thinking of ways to create a product that is new and novel and
believe we have some decent idea.



You plan is great.



Give me some time to look into grant money. Please do not work on this
anymore until I get back to you.



I have enough info to push this forward for now.



Max Hill, C.E.T

Mascore Helical Piles

905-807-4389



*From:* Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
*Sent:* Monday, January 12, 2026 12:06 PM
*To:* Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca>
*Subject:* Re: New Project



Hi Max



the patent lawyers who I know best are litigators but I do know some people
who do product development and will reach out.



I believe there may be government money available - have you looked into
that at all?



I see the next steps as:

   - *1. Legal Scoping*: counsel reviews the existing (U.S.) patent and
   scopes a design mandate focused on avoiding infringement under Canadian
   law. The scope and cost of this work will depend whether the goal is:


   - (a) to avoid infringing the existing patent (i.e., design-around), or
      - (b) to create something patentable by Mascore itself (i.e.,
      inventive and novel under the *Patent Act*).


   - *2 ‚Äì Technical Development*: The product designer works within
   specified parameters to generate technical outputs, i.e. designs, models,
   and prototypes to achieve (a) or (b)
   - *3 ‚Äì Legal Review*: counsel reviews the technical outputs and provides
   a follow-up opinion or informal assessment confirming whether the resulting
   design achieves (a) or (b)
   - *4 ‚Äì Filing & Prosecution (if pursuing a patent strategy)*: If the
   objective under Step 1 includes creating patentable subject matter, a
   separate workstream is initiated for preparation and prosecution of
   Mascore‚Äôs own patent application.

what do you think of the above?











*Matthew AJ* *Levine*

Barrister & Solicitor



This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and
is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message
in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.







On Fri, Jan 9, 2026 at 12:30‚ÄØPM Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca> wrote:

There is a US company that owns a patent on a unique deep foundation
product.



It is technically a helical pile, but it is modified and has a continuous
flight added to it that pull down concrete during installation making the
foundation much stronger. Attached is the brochure for reference.



Also attached is the Canadian and US patent.



My thoughts are:



   - The patent drawing is technically different from what they actually
   produce, although similar. The patent shows a helical shape plate with 2-3
   revolution where what they actually build is a single revolution helix
   plate.
   - We build a similar product already without a helix plate. See attached
   drawing.
   - Need to figure out a way to prove this isn‚Äôt ‚Äúnovel‚Äù
   - What type of modification can we make to it to make our own novelty?
   - An American company produces this and has plans to bring it to Canada.
   We‚Äôd like to stop this by competing with it.



I understand you earn a patent lawyer, but do you have any contacts?



Please let us know your thoughts.



Max Hill, C.E.T

Mascore Helical Piles

905-807-4389



*From:* Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
*Sent:* Friday, January 9, 2026 11:11 AM
*To:* Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca>
*Subject:* Re: New Project



Hi Max



very interested. please send more info.



(i'm not a patent lawyer, as you know.)



happy new year





*Matthew AJ* *Levine*

Barrister & Solicitor



This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and
is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message
in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.







On Thu, Jan 8, 2026 at 9:12‚ÄØAM Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca> wrote:

HI Matthew,



Hope you are well.



I have a new project I am working on that involved patent expertise.



There is an existing product in our market that we would like to start
offering that is patented.



We would like to build a similar product without infringing or having
ourselves covered in the event of a legal action.



Is this something you can help us with?



If so, I will provide further details.



Max Hill, C.E.T

Mascore Helical Piles

905-807-4389

emails.snippet: Hi Matthew, Thank you for sharing. Well it's a learning curve for me. I have read both agreements. So Stream Money cannot onboard, Equals can and SM is purely acting as an introducer to EM.
emails.body:
Hi Matthew,

Thank you for sharing. Well it's a learning curve for me. I have read both
agreements.
So Stream Money cannot onboard, Equals can and SM is purely acting as an
introducer to EM. Initially I thought we didn't need an EPA after finishing
the document read (this is my first time so I did some digging). In my
view, the EM client agreement should govern every element. However from a
legal/ commercial perspective it seems that even if Equal Money onboards SM
clients, the SM client is still considered to be interacting with Stream
Money commercially. I see two different aspects used here: a) from a
regulatory lens, and b) from a legal/commercial lens. Keen to understand:
if something goes wrong with the onboarding or funds who is liable?
I think a client-facing agreement may be required considering that SM is
branding the service, commercially involved , invoicing clients directly,
providing the front-end tech platform, and intends to have contractual
control over the introduced clients. It is important to understand that
even if Equals is the regulated entity, clients might perceive they are
using Stream's platform as a Stream client. Please correct me if I
misunderstood.

I'll be in the office tomorrow. Let's pick up.

Thanks and regards
*Tulika Dhar *
Head of Compliance
[image: email]*tulika.d@stream.money <tulika.d@stream.money>*

[image: Stream Money] <https://stream.money/>

*Disclaimer*
This email (and any attachments) is confidential and may be legally
privileged. If you are not the intended recipient, please notify the
sender, delete this email, and do not copy, use, or disclose it. Unless
expressly stated in a signed agreement, nothing in this email constitutes
legal, tax, accounting, investment, or other professional advice, or an
offer or solicitation to engage in any transaction. Although reasonable
steps are taken to screen for viruses or other malware, the Stream Money
does not accept liability for any loss or damage arising from the use of
this email or attachments; please perform your own checks. Stream Money is
a trading style of: Stream Ventures Ltd, registered in England and Wales
(No.13560798), registered address: Flat 7, Grange House, 7 Grange Road,
Gravesend, DA11 0EB; StreamDigital Sp zoo, registered in Poland (No.
0001089202), registered office: Hoza Street, No 86, Room 210, Warsaw 00682,
Poland, VASP Licence RDWW-1191; and Snowcap Financial Ltd, incorporated in
British Columbia, Canada (No. BC1484570), registered office: 1285 West
Broadway, Suite 600, Vancouver, British Columbia, V6H 3X8, MSB Licence
C100000166, registered with FINTRAC Canada. In the UK, Stream Ventures Ltd
is registered with the Information Commissioner√¢s Office and complies with
UK GDPR and applicable data protection laws.

*Risk Warning*
Digital asset services are provided by StreamDigital Sp zoo and Snowcap
Financial Ltd. Snowcap Financial Ltd also acts as a Payment Services
Provider (PSP), Foreign Exchange provider, and global foreign exchange
service provider. Digital assets are high-risk and may not be suitable for
all recipients; values can be volatile and you may lose all invested
capital. Personal data in this email may be processed by the Stream Money
and its service providers for legitimate business, security, and regulatory
purposes, in accordance with our applicable privacy notice.



On Tue, 24 Feb 2026 at 16:40, Matthew Levine <matthew@stream.money> wrote:

> Hi Tulika
>
> This is very much a draft, but wanted to check if you have any preliminary
> comments or suggestions.
>
> The attached 'Enterprise Platform Agreement' is for clients who engage
> with SnowCap either from Berkeley or as new clients. In both cases, they
> are going through Stream/SnowCap to be *onboarded* to Equals.
>
> I expect to ultimately revise for clients who are *onboarded* to Stream.
>
> Best regards
>

Lena

Hope you're well.

Following up for our colleague Matthew Levine (Legal & CAMLRO based in
Canada; email: matthew@get-stream.com), who couldn't join yesterday's trial
kick-off session: ahead of Friday's call, can you generate his user access
to try using the platform?

Many thanks in advance

Kind regards
*Tulika Dhar *
Head of Compliance

>>>> Hi all,

>>>> Thanks again for your time today. Quick recap of what we‚Äôve heard, and
>>>> the proposed next steps.
>>>> *What we‚Äôve heard*
>>>>
>>>>    - You‚Äôre building institutional digital asset flows on Fireblocks
>>>>    (custody + payments), with *low volume / high value activity* (min
>>>>    ~$50k, up to ~$1m).
>>>>    - The book is predominantly stablecoins (eg USDT on Tron plus
>>>>    Ethereum-based rails), so cross-chain tracing and broad chain coverage
>>>>    matter.
>>>>    - You don‚Äôt have blockchain analytics in place today, and you need
>>>>    this to support licensing and ongoing compliance.
>>>>    - You want a *clear, auditable screening workflow that reduces
>>>>    manual work and false positives,* with strong controls (roles,
>>>>    approvals, audit trail).
>>>>    - Preference is for a* group-wide risk policy* you can map across
>>>>    jurisdictions, while still accounting for local regulatory expectations
>>>>    where needed.
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> *What we covered*
>>>>
>>>>    - Elliptic‚Äôs holistic screening approach (cross-chain/cross-hop) to *avoid
>>>>    chain-by-chain scanning and minimise unnecessary investigations*.
>>>>    - Risk Engine configuration (exposure thresholds, proximity-based
>>>>    scoring to curb false positives, and policy design either globally or per
>>>>    jurisdiction).
>>>>    - Fireblocks integration workflow: *risk scores in Fireblocks with
>>>>    deep links to Elliptic* results, plus export/API options for audit
>>>>    and reporting.
>>>>
>>>> *Next steps*
>>>>
>>>>    - I‚Äôve attached the trial request form and a couple of time options
>>>>    for a 30-min setup to align the initial policy and connect the workflow to
>>>>    your Fireblocks AML policies.
>>>>       - *Action*: Please fill this out, book the kick off/check
>>>>       in/wrap up sessions
>>>>    - Freddie will follow up separately on Travel Rule (Notabene) and
>>>>    the Fireblocks procurement path.
>>>>    - In the trial, we‚Äôll validate the key outcomes: policy fit, false
>>>>    positive rate, review workflow, and audit artefacts.

emails.body:
Hi Matthew

I will get my accountant to calculate my Mom's capital gains tax , they
already have done work on her income tax, and their familiar with her file.
    Concerning the Probate, or ( Estate Administration Tax).,I will not
apply,or pursue,for any kind of refund, not worth it , plus the headache
and cost of it ,as you mentioned ,no thanks..It's been paid, that's the
important thing.
    Yes,that would be great if your bookkeeper ,as you mentioned, can send
the total cost of the legal fees or the trust ledger ofcourse,as soon as
available or possible.
     This way we can start working on,  calculating the capital gains tax
owing right away.

Thanks

Zeljko

On Fri., Feb. 20, 2026, 3:50 p.m. Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
wrote:

> Hi Zeljko
>
> Thanks and sorry for silence. its been unusually busy.
>
> I do not know 100% that I can calculate what is owed on the capital gains
> and I would normally suggesting reaching out to your accountant.
>
> In terms of the potential revaluation of the Estate Administration Tax. My
> understanding is that if new information about the Fair Market Value at the
> time of passing comes to light, then a revised Estate Information Return
> should be submitted to the Ministry of Finance. But, it is not guaranteed
> that the Ministry will reassess the tax payable. The Ministry will focus on
> whether there is new information that results in the FMV having been
> incorrectly calculated. Simply the fact that the shares were sold for less
> than the original FMV is not sufficient.   There may technically be a
> refund available, but the cost of proving the historical value needs to be
> taken into account. I believe it would most likely exceed the recovery. I
> will ask a colleague for a second opinion. let me know what you think.
>
> I will get my bookeeper to prepare and send over the trust ledger. I hope
> you have a good weekend and sorry not to be able to provide a more
> immediate positive response.
>
> *Matthew AJ* *Levine*
>
> Barrister & Solicitor
>

In terms of 1.01 (c) -- I've kept the original change. I want to explain, the text is below with the change in red.


to the extent assignable, the full benefit of all service agreements (the ‚ÄúService Agreements‚Äù) to which the Vendor is a party in connection with the Business;

This refers to the Service Agreement that you and your business entered into as part of operating the store / business. It provides that you assign your interest in those contracts to the Purchaser. Please confirm receipt.




Matthew AJ Levine

Subject: Asset Purchase Agreement

Hi Tejvir

As discussed, I've marked up the Asset Purchase Agreement.  I've also summarized the review. Both are attached

We can send the redline to the lawyer on the other side. But, I just want to flag the overlapping to do list.

1. Subway Transfer Package

This is the most important outstanding item. You will want to review Subway‚Äôs franchise transfer documentation, including:

  *   The franchise termination or assignment agreement;

  *   Any release of your obligations and personal guarantees; and

  *   The sublease assignment and guarantor release language.

We should not finalize the APA without confirming how Subway is structuring the transfer and whether full written releases will be provided.

2. Security Deposit Amount

I put in the draft that the buyer will compensate you for the value of the security deposit. Please try to confirm the amount so we know whether it is worth negotiating over.

3. PPSA / Encumbrance Check

Please ask your bank to confirm whether there are any outstanding security interests or charges against the equipment or other assets.

Once we have clarity on the above, we can pull together the closing agenda.

Let me know if you have questions / comments or would like to review anything by phone before we send out the redline

Best regards
Matthew



Matthew AJ Levine

Barrister & Solicitor


1235 Bay Street, Suite 700, TORONTO, M5R 3K4

T: +1 (647) 598-2598

emails.snippet: Dear Village Shul Community, As we reflect on the success of last week's campaign we are filled with immense gratitude and pride. Together, we set out to raise 360000, and together, we raised over
emails.body:
Dear Village Shul Community,

As we reflect on the success of last week's campaign we are filled with immense gratitude and pride.

Together, we set out to raise $360,000, and together, we raised over $520,000. This achievement is not only about the funds raised, but about what it represents: a united community that believes deeply in our mission and in one another.

Your generosity sends a powerful message of commitment, strength, and love for our shul and everything it stands for. Because of you, we are able to continue growing, inspiring, and strengthening Jewish life for so many individuals and families.

On behalf of the Board of Directors, our administrators, and our dedicated staff team, thank you for your trust, your partnership, and your unwavering support.

Wishing you and your families a wonderful week filled with blessings.

With deep appreciation,
Rabbi Sytner, Rabbi Katz, The Board of Directors,
Shul Administration, and Staff Team

           The Village Shul
1072 Eglinton Avenue West
Toronto, ON M6C 2E2
www.ourvillageshul.com
         
Unsubscribe | Manage Preferences

emails.snippet: A candid, practical session on succession planning for Canadian business owners. Across Canada, many small business owners are approaching an important crossroads. Whether retirement is a few years
emails.body:
Across Canada, many small business owners are approaching an important crossroads. Whether retirement is a few years away or simply on the horizon, questions about succession are becoming more pressing.

If you are thinking about stepping back, planning for succession, or exploring your options, you may be asking:
*
What is my business really worth?
*
Who could realistically take over?
*
How long does a transition take?
*
Where do I even begin?
The transition process can feel complex and emotional. That‚Äôs why Digital Main Street is pleased to share this practical and candid webinar designed specifically for business owners who want to better understand their options and begin planning their next chapter. The webinar is hosted by our Founder, John Kiru!

Bringing Clarity to Succession Planning
Date: March 3
Time: 9:00 AM EST
Location: Live on Zoom
Cost: Free

Registration: https://us06web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_NQrGZ5KYTIexPeGRZbnUug https://us06web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_NQrGZ5KYTIexPeGRZbnUug [ https://us06web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_NQrGZ5KYTIexPeGRZbnUug ]

During this session, you will learn:
*
Why succession often feels overwhelming
*
The most common barriers owners face
*
Different transition paths, including family transitions, employee share ownership plans, and third-party sales
*
The key stages of a sale, from business readiness and valuation to due diligence, financing, and transition
*
How thoughtful planning protects confidentiality and strengthens negotiating confidence
This webinar is ideal for business owners across Canada who are considering exiting their business within the next 10 years, or who simply want to understand their long-term options.

Speakers:
John Kiru, CEO, Toronto Association of Business Improvement Areas (TABIA) and Founder of Digital Main Street
Alison Anderson, Founder, SuccessionMatching

Confidentiality: Audience members will not see who else is attending.
Small businesses are the backbone of communities across Canada. Ensuring smooth transitions helps protect jobs, preserve local economies, and safeguard the legacy you have worked hard to build.

If you are beginning to think about your next step, even if it feels early, this session will provide clarity, structure, and practical insight.

https://us06web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_NQrGZ5KYTIexPeGRZbnUug Register Now

 

Digital Main Street Partners

https://digitalmainstreet.ca/

 

Let's Connect

https://www.facebook.com/DigitalMainStreet
https://www.linkedin.com/company/digitalmainstreet/
https://www.instagram.com/digitalmainstreet/
https://x.com/digital_mainst
mailto:info@digitalmainstreet.ca

100 Princes‚Äô BlvdToronto, ON M6K 3C3

to the extent assignable, the full benefit of all service agreements (the ‚ÄúService Agreements‚Äù) to which the Vendor is a party in connection with the Business;

Subject: Asset Purchase Agreement

Hi Tejvir

As discussed, I've marked up the Asset Purchase Agreement.  I've also summarized the review. Both are attached

We can send the redline to the lawyer on the other side. But, I just want to flag the overlapping to do list.

1. Subway Transfer Package

This is the most important outstanding item. You will want to review Subway‚Äôs franchise transfer documentation, including:

  *   The franchise termination or assignment agreement;

  *   Any release of your obligations and personal guarantees; and

  *   The sublease assignment and guarantor release language.

We should not finalize the APA without confirming how Subway is structuring the transfer and whether full written releases will be provided.

2. Security Deposit Amount

I put in the draft that the buyer will compensate you for the value of the security deposit. Please try to confirm the amount so we know whether it is worth negotiating over.

3. PPSA / Encumbrance Check

Please ask your bank to confirm whether there are any outstanding security interests or charges against the equipment or other assets.

Once we have clarity on the above, we can pull together the closing agenda.

Let me know if you have questions / comments or would like to review anything by phone before we send out the redline

Best regards
Matthew



Matthew AJ Levine

Barrister & Solicitor


1235 Bay Street, Suite 700, TORONTO, M5R 3K4

T: +1 (647) 598-2598


This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.

emails.snippet: hey Matthew following up on our conversation about the Second Brain Kickstart package. wanted to give you a heads up ‚Äî starting March 1st, two things change: 1. prices go up across all packages 2. the
emails.body:
hey Matthew

following up on our conversation about the Second Brain Kickstart package.

wanted to give you a heads up ‚Äî starting March 1st, two things change:
1. prices go up across all packages
2. the 1:1 setup call gets replaced with an AI Agent

for a legal practice like yours, the 1:1 is where we'd architect the
whole system together ‚Äî research workflows, client management,
document automation. the AI version won't have that live session.

all packages now include WhatsApp community access (60+ builders
sharing workflows daily).

if you want the current version with direct access, this is the last week.

here's the page: https://www.iwoszapar.com/second-brain-ai

Iwo
